definition: clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: The liberals prefer to sit on the fence while the other parties fight it out.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨寧可抱騎牆態度，坐待其他黨派去鬥爭到底。

sentences.english: Mr Maliki is wooing smaller Shia parties.
sentences.chinese: 馬利基一直在爭取小型什葉黨派的支持。

sentences.english: The G.O.P. used to be the party of business.
sentences.chinese: 過去，美國老大黨曾是一個支持商業發展的黨派。

sentences.english: The next step was to secure the administration against partisan attack.
sentences.chinese: 下一個步驟是防止政府受到黨派性的攻擊。

sentences.english: Each party insists that its levers will work best.
sentences.chinese: 每個黨派都堅持認爲各自的槓桿最有效。

sentences.english: Rival supporters fought running battles on the streets of the capital Conakry.
sentences.chinese: 不同黨派的支持者在首都科納克里街頭展開了爭鬥。

sentences.english: Blanchflower, who says he has no party affiliation.
sentences.chinese: 布蘭奇弗勞爾表示自己沒有黨派關聯。

sentences.english: It is as if the party is abdicating its role in organizing dissent.
sentences.chinese: 似乎這個黨派正在放棄其組織抗議的角色。

sentences.english: The town-hall meeting showed evidence of the partisan divide in America.
sentences.chinese: 這次市鎮大會表明了美國黨派的分歧。

sentences.english: And he promised to transcend those partisan divisions.
sentences.chinese: 他承諾要超越這些黨派紛爭。

sentences.english: There is a great divide between liberals and conservatives in the government.
sentences.chinese: 政府涇渭分明地分爲了自由黨和保守黨兩個黨派。

sentences.english: He argues that the Tories will always be seen as the party of privilege.
sentences.chinese: 他的論調是，保守黨總是被看作特權階級的黨派。

sentences.english: Courtesy these greedy Corrupt all Political leaders from all parties, headed by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 以國會爲首的各黨派政治領導人貪婪腐化使然。

sentences.english: Self-construction is a key factor which determines if democratic parties can become high-quality parties participating in government and political affairs.
sentences.chinese: 自身建設是民主黨派成爲高素質參政黨的關鍵所在。

sentences.english: Several political parties allied with each other against higher taxes.
sentences.chinese: 幾個政治黨派聯合起來反對堤高稅收。

sentences.english: The space between his party and Mr Berlusconi’s is occupied by the Union of Christian and Centre Democrats (UDC).
sentences.chinese: 他和貝魯斯科尼黨派之間是基督教和中間民主黨聯盟。

definition: group of people/camp/faction/sides in a dispute
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
to take turns/to work by roster
Green Standard Army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
